repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
When a mark is deleted in the neovim instance but present in the shada file, compare their timestamps. If the neovim mark was modified later, then flush the mark in the shada file.

Currently works with lower/uppercase marks; doesn't work for file marks and special marks like `"` and `.`.

Attempts to fix #4295.

comment_data.body: Is there a more concise way to do this (look up buffer handle by buffer filename)? Not sure if this will be brittle in some unforeseen way.
There is a `find_buffer` static function in shada.c, but it does caching so I don't know if it's necessary. Looks like the only thing it's doing differently is using `FNAMECMP` instead of `strequal`.
Yes, this is what I was thinking as well. I'll try it out and see.
Sanitizer complains about this, I think you need to let this entry through and free it only when discarding it. Try what I suggested before.

Use single quotes, so
```suggestion
  it('updates deleted marks', function()
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -248,4 +249,26 @@ describe('ShaDa support code', function()
     eq('', funcs.system(argv))
     eq(0, exc_exec('rshada'))
   end)
+
+  it("updates deleted marks", function()

comment_data.body: I would get the value of `os_time()` only once, just before the `for (p = (char_u *)eap->arg; *p != NUL; p++)` loop

comment_regular_data.body:
> https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/15831 will make the implementation of #16067 a lot simpler: the problem was that `getmark_buf` only returns a `pos_T` and not the full `fmark_T` structure, which this PR resolves. Overall seems like a very useful refactor.

@chentoast  https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/15831 will be merged by next week.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

labels.description: save/restore editor state: shada, context, ctx
labels.name: editor-state

title: fix(shada): remove deleted marks from shada
